questions.question: Where can you find the remarkable remnants of a Roman city that was buried under volcanic ash in 79 AD, located in Italy?
questions.context: This ancient city near Naples gives insight into Roman life and is famously associated with Mount Vesuvius.

questions.question: Which European capital is home to a museum housing one of the largest collections of impressionist and post-impressionist masterpieces?
questions.context: This museum, in a former railway station, features works by Monet, Manet, Van Gogh, and more, and is located along the Seine River.

questions.question: In which city is the tallest building in the world, an iconic piece of modern architecture completed in 2010, located?
questions.context: Standing at 828 meters, this skyscraper represents the rapid growth and ambition of the United Arab Emirates.

questions.question: Identify the space exploration site, which was the launch site of the first human-made object to orbit the Earth, located in Central Asia.
questions.context: This historic site launched Sputnik 1 in 1957 and continues to be a major international spaceport.

questions.question: Which icon of ancient Roman engineering, originally used for chariot races, is located in the heart of Rome?
questions.context: Once the largest stadium in ancient Rome, it could accommodate over 150,000 spectators for various public events.
